node.title: Nearly 25 years after an appalling murder, this couple is keeping a promise from a world away
node.alt: An older couple standing in a tropical garden in front of a stone monument.
node.description: After Japanese student Michiko Okuyama was killed in Cairns in 1997, Luiza and John Grave promised her family they would maintain her memorial garden. A quarter of a century later, they're still as good as their word.
node.content:
["For almost 25 years a Cairns couple have kept their promise to the loved ones of a Japanese student who was murdered in the city,\u00a0 but as age takes its toll they are wondering who will take up the responsibility in their stead.", "Warning: This story contains details that some readers may find distressing.\u00a0", "Michiko Okuyama, 22, was brutally killed by a teenage boy in 1997, shocking the community.", "She had only been in Cairns for six days before she disappeared.", "Three weeks later, her naked, decomposing body was found dumped near a swamp in Manunda.", "A year after Ms Okuyama's death, a memorial garden and monument was erected not far from where she was murdered.", "Since then, John and Luiza Grave have kept their promise to Ms Okuyama's family to take care of it.", "\"When the memorial was made, the family said that if it was in Japan, they would visit it every day to look after the garden and talk to Michiko,\" Ms Grave said.", "", "
Michiko Okuyama had only been in Cairns for six days before she was murdered.(Supplied: Robert Reid)
", "The Graves\u00a0still drop by every week to pay their respects and clean up the site.", "But now they are older,\u00a0they are concerned about who will take over the responsibility when they are no longer able to.", "\"We will do it until we drop off,\" Mr Grave said.", "
The murder
", "On the day Ms Okuyama went missing, she told her friends she was going to the shops.", "Police later discovered that she had been murdered in a Grafton Street warehouse by a 16-year-old boy.", "Ten days after he killed\u00a0Ms Okuyama, the teen put her body in a wheelie bin and dragged it three kilometres across town.", "Then he dumped Ms Okuyama's remains under pandanus leaves near the Manunda swamp.", "The boy was later found guilty of murder.", "Due to his age at the time he has never been publicly identified.", "", "
The memorial was created\u00a0a\u00a0year after Ms Okuyama's appalling death.(ABC Far North: Phil Brandel)
", "
The promise
", "Mr Grave's answer as to why he made the promise to Ms Okuyama's family is simple.", "\"Why wouldn't I?\" he asked.", "What was once a daily ritual to tend the garden\u00a0has slowed over time, but the couple's\u00a0commitment has never wavered.", "Over the past 25 years, they have removed nappies, condoms, syringes, cigarette butts and excrement from the garden.", "\"We found a guy asleep here one day,\" Mr Grave said.", "\"When he left\u00a0he covered the tiles in faeces, which I then had to wash down with buckets.", "\"Before the Cairns Performing Arts Centre (CPAC) was built, people used to camp here, but thanks to the new lighting and the security guards, they have kept the campers away.\"", "", "
The entrance to the garden memorial is now at the back of the performing arts centre.(ABC Far North: Phil Brandel)
", "
Time fades away
", "Mr Grave's mobility has been limited by osteoarthritis and his wife has been helping with the cleaning.", "The council, too, has been lending a hand.", "\"When John was mobile, he would visit every day after he dropped me at work,\" Ms Grave said.", "The Graves still send the odd Christmas card or letter to Ms Okuyama's mother in Japan, but she rarely responds.", "\"She can't read or write in English, so she needs a translator,\" Ms Grave said.", "\"The family still occasionally travels from Japan to visit the memorial, but nobody has been here, that we are aware\u00a0of, for over five years."]
